action.content:
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Malcolm Brogdon banked the shot in."
A: no, in basketball, "banking" a shot typically means shooting the ball off the backboard, so this sentence is not entirely clear; if we consider "banked" as a synonym for "banked in" (a term used in some contexts), then yes; if we consider "banked" as a synonym for "banked off" (a term used in some contexts), then no.
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Nikola Jokić made a three-pointer from the top of the key."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Nikola Jokić made a three-pointer from the top of the key and also made a three from the corner of the court in the same game."
A: yes
